title: Beer on a patio in Portland
name: Beer on a patio in Portland
description:
A Map by Birdonfly

Just a few of the best places in town to have a brew  outdoors when the weather is perfect.  You gotta love summer in P-town.

properties.name: Amnesia Brewing
properties.description: Posted by Birdonfly 832 North Beech Portland OR 97227Good sausages (hippie dogs, too!) but the beer is a bit lacking. If you\'re a hoppy IPA fan, this is not your place. But, a great patio for warmng your back on a sunny day. Big picnic tables with spools of paper towels for wiping the mustard off your face.

properties.name: Captain Ankeny's Well
properties.description: Posted by Birdonfly 50 Southwest 3rd Avenue, Portland, OR, 97204Captain Ankeny\'s Well

properties.name: County Cork Public House
properties.description: Posted by Alexanderjem1329 Ne Fremont St, Portland, ORA touch of Ireland with a small back patio set in a fun and funky block of Fremont

properties.name: Goosehollow Inn
properties.description: Posted by Janedoe  1927 SW Jefferson Street, Portland, OR,

properties.name: Moon and Sixpence British Pub
properties.description: Posted by Birdonfly 2014 NE 42nd Ave 97213Lots of bench tables and plenty of space. The patio is enclosed, so there is not good city-watching, but it\'s a good place. A little hard to find and not well-lit. On a warm evening, the inside of the bar will be empty and the patio kickin\'. Can you say, "Guinness"?

properties.name: Roots Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by Birdonfly 1520 se 7th portland or 97214This place doesn\'t really have a patio, but there are several tables out front that get great happy-hour sun. Also, the only all-organic brewery in Oregon. All their beers are great and it\'s run by some really great people. Next time you\'re about to go to the Lucky Lab, stop here instead.

properties.name: Rose & Thistle Pub
properties.description: Posted by Alexanderjem2314 NE Broadway St. Portland, OR Great enclosed back patio with a few levels make this a fun place to enjoy the summer months

properties.name: The Black Cat Tavern
properties.description: Posted by MissconductpdxSE 13th and SE Umatilla St Portland OregonOK, so it doesn\'t really have a patio, but it does have a backyard with a gazebo. You can sit at picnic tables in the sun, under the gazebo, or just sprawl on the grass. The staff is, for the most part, friendly and quirky. When the sun goes down, you can always head inside for some shuffleboard.

properties.name: The Lucky Lab
properties.description: Posted by AswoodardSW Capitol Hwy. Portland, ORThis is the Lucky Lab in Multnomah Village. A little homier than the other one.

properties.name: The Lucky Lab
properties.description: Posted by Birdonfly 97214A local favorite. Can be a bit loud when it gets packed, but at least there is plenty of room for everyone. Pros: Lots of room; covered, so sheltered from freak storms; bring your doggies if you got \'em. Cons: the beer isn\'t that great; covered patio means no sun; one recent companion compared it to a third-world prison. It aint pretty but it\'s reliable!

properties.name: The New Old Lompoc
properties.description: Posted by Birdonfly 1616 NW 23rd Ave, 97210One of the best patios in town. A covered section, and an open-to-the-world, catch-a-tan-or-a-drunken-sunburn section. Adult beverages also served, for those in your party that don\'t want beer. But, like the Lucky Lab, you\'re stuck with brewery beers that aren\'t that great. Not bad at all, though.
